story: Mohamed Alaa El Din shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: JavaScript Array Methods Reference - Impressive Webs
caption: impressivewebs.com
description: Back in July I wrote a post called JavaScript String Methods Reference, outlining many of the ways strings can be manipulated in JavaScript. Another area where JavaScript has a number of different methods available for use is Array manipulation, which I'll cover in this post. As usual, I'll do my be...

data.message: If you need to deal with IE8, be careful, not all will work. I think IndexOf doesn't.
Thanks for the info ya gameel yes indexOf is not supported in IE8 but we only support 9+ :) isn't that cooool :D

In my current project, we are using JSHint on the build server to prevent having invalid JavaScript checked-in. One of the rules we enforce is: no console.log calls are to be pushed to the repository.

You do console.log just for a bit of quick debugging, and that's all. If you need it with IE8 or IE7 debugging, you run IE9 or IE10 with dev toolbar open and Browser/DOM modes set to the version you need.
by the way my ex manager will be working in your company at the beginning of the next month .
Sounds awesome. What's his name? Any idea how he heard about Readify? Would you like to consider it too? ;)
His name is michael fahim... he already have an immigration visa and tried to search about best companies there before leaving Egypt and he got accepted...
Yeah, he is in Sydney and we have met already. He may even start earlier than planned :)
yeah... he was my manager for more than a year... almost the best manager i have ever had on all levels... (personal ,technical, managerial)..... he will be a member of your team ?
No, he will probably be joining another team than the one I lead, the same client though (big one).
